result.execSummary:
The defendant Marques A Majors was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.
Consecutive to: Prison sentence on Ct 3

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Report to ZCI tomorrow for installation of SCRAM. Defendant must successfully complete the Drug Court Program.  Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes:
**AMENDED 6-25-2015:  Defendant is eligible to participate in the in-jail BHS AODA program.  Upon completion, balance of jail time is STAYED and defendant must complete all recommended continuing care under the supervision of the Department of Corrections.**
Defendant to serve 30 days with balance Imposed and Stayed
Huber for work, school and treatment. 
Defendant cannot report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances. Absolute sobriety is required.
AMENDED 05/27/2015 - Defendant to serve 30 days in Behavioral Health Services program starting 06/01/15 and released once completed.

Defendant Marques A Majors in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Arraignment scheduled for September 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  No contact with the co-defendant.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
